jurisdiction.title: Council of Chief State School Officers

CE28F83537E4400C93A1993B07763775.description:
with increasing
independence use frequently
occurring regular plural
nouns, verbs,
prepositions, and
question words;  ask and answer
interrogatives (wh- questions); and produce and expand
simple sentences
in shared language
activities.

9FA2FD41773B4FCE8BAF99B68E516E84.description:
with support (context and
visual aids), recognize and use
frequently occurring
regular plural nouns,
verbs, and prepositions; use and respond to
question words; and produce and expand
simple sentences
in shared language
activities.

3781CB073D354CF0A96EAC7199AB0822.description:
with support (including
context and visual aids), recognize and use
frequently occurring
regular plural nouns,
verbs, and prepositions; use and respond to
question words; and produce simple
sentences
in shared language
activities.

A919E27A5CFF46D0B58BA291C978F118.description:
with support (including
context and visual aids), recognize and use
frequently occurring
nouns, verbs, and short
phrases, respond to yes/no and
wh- questions, and produce a few simple
sentences
in shared language
activities.

7F8E3DCB12004E0784778E7F6E5F25A5.description:
with support (including
context and visual aids), recognize and use a
small number of
frequently occurring
nouns and verbs, and understand and respond
to simple questions.

B01625903E674932BA45E656073FD148.description:
An ELL can make accurate
use of standard
English to
communicate in
grade-appropriate

speech and
writing.

7A5A19E38C2A4393B66664A7667E9A6D.description:
with support (including
visual aids), retell a short sequence
of events from
experience or a familiar
story, with a beginning,
middle, and end
using frequently
occurring linking words.

F485D79829754FBBA1695E0BE00ADFC9.description:
with support (including
visual aids, context), retell a simple sequence
of events from
experience or a familiar
story
with increasingly
independent control of
frequently occurring
linking words.

310E4DDDC2BD4A5293FCEE3D55B302C7.description:
with support (including
visual aids, context), retell several events
from experience or a
familiar story
with developing control of
some frequently occurring
linking words (e.g., and,
then).

EF6A2242846340F6B64DF193895D44BB.description:
An ELL can create clear and
coherent gradeappropriate

speech and
text.

FD593C83F65B470DA94A3DAE31E30D90.description:
with prompting and
support (including context
and visual aids), answer and ask
questions about the
meaning of words and
phrases
in simple oral
presentations and readalouds
about a variety of
topics, experiences, or
events.

E680831158C84B808EF42B7781B9E419.description:
with prompting and
support (including context
and visual aids), answer and sometimes
ask questions about the
meaning of words and
phrases
in simple oral
presentations and readalouds
about a variety of
topics, experiences, or
events.

7D57A2FF88594B26A26AEE3E73DAE328.description:
with prompting and
support (including context
and visual aids), answer questions to help
determine the meaning
of some words and
phrases
in simple oral
presentations and readalouds
about familiar
topics, experiences, or
events.

B56B9D06375F4AD6913ABD21EFB04968.description:
with prompting and
support (including context
and visual aids), recognize the meaning of
some frequently
occurring words and
phrases
in simple oral
presentations and readalouds
about familiar
topics, experiences, or
events.

86E19D1D4FEA4ECA9E09497EFB551371.description:
with prompting and
support (including context
and visual aids), recognize the meaning of
a few frequently
occurring words
in simple oral
presentations and readalouds
about familiar
topics, experiences, or
events.

C75523AA969D4BF1A93288C3764AC076.description:
An ELL can determine the
meaning of
words and
phrases in oral
presentations
and literary and
informational
text.

22C44DD67EE3452E919D5BFF8D9600A8.description:
show awareness of
differences between
informal (“playground
speech”) and language
appropriate to the
classroom, and use some words learned
through conversations,
reading, and being read
to.

CA0468B8DCAA40E7AFD69BDB68F82BFE.description:
show a developing
awareness of the
difference between
appropriate language for
the playground and
language for the
classroom.

E1A4D0A1FA504C9D8C334C241A12EA8B.description:
An ELL can adapt language
choices to
purpose, task,
and audience
when speaking
and writing.

55B65FFB12F64B08BC7402C36BF75459.description:
with prompting and
support, identify appropriate
reasons an author or
speaker gives to
support main points.

13EBA2539E824070A9F78209BFD3E1C0.description:
with prompting and
support, identify a reason an
author or speaker gives
to support a point.

A723158E99C542F49D2F322C1C61DBEC.description:
An ELL can analyze and
critique the
arguments of
others orally and
in writing.

D1576480A3BF49C0A47B301D1E4875DF.description:
with prompting and
support from adults, recall information from
experience or use
information from
provided sources to
answer a question
showing increasing
control

77BB14C4A1404DC2897B875CE6F988E1.description:
with prompting and
support from adults, recall information from
experience or use
information from
provided sources to
answer a question
showing increasing
control.

8D1DFD9ECC9745B8971303A350342C10.description:
with prompting and
support from adults recall information from experience or use
information from
provided sources to
answer a question
showing developing
control.

D2F2DA6C431D4B8BB5396CE37F71D466.description:
with prompting and
support from adults, recall information from
experience or use
information from a
provided source to
answer a question.

CF5C6B1248044555A37597ED850C5B78.description:
with prompting and
support from adults, recall information from
experience or from a
provided source.

C5FBBD8C5D894E53AB35BCAA204CA1DB.description:
An ELL can conduct
research and
evaluate and
communicate
findings to
answer
questions or
solve problems.

3C941728DC144EC19BA14B3C979E719F.description:
express an opinion or
preference
about a variety of topics
or stories
showing increasing
control.

65F452DA9A5D4158878E5EF0AC65C114.description:
express an opinion or
preference
about a variety of topics or
stories
showing increasing control.

B55C518C64D943AD8F9EA45408D93D66.description:
express an opinion or
preference
about a familiar topic or
story
showing developing control.

3999CAFCAD2242DDA4DF67FF93F33225.description:
express an opinion or
preference
about a familiar topic
showing emerging control.

892CFBF3E0D34678BFFF334C1BE724D1.description:
express a feeling or
opinion
about a familiar topic
showing limited control.

7CB6F70BECFA46B8BC115E8CA8933937.description:
An ELL can construct grade-appropriate
oral
and written
claims and
support them
with reasoning
and evidence.

A69A9D090B5C4A21804711C1ACA183A4.description:
make simple oral
presentations and compose short written
texts
about a variety of topics,
experiences, or events.

E3F6728CF50447958263651E5E0D92D6.description:
tell or dictate simple
messages
about a variety of topics,
experiences, or events.

E694C402F6FC44F1A4745A4636C02219.description:
communicate
information or feelings
about familiar topics,
experiences, or events.

838199439E1641199D6FE7B4673E4AEC.description:
communicate simple
information or feelings
about familiar topics,
experiences, or events.

DE1C6F3AB43744AF9D29EB2B514C3F51.description:
communicate simple
information or feelings
about familiar topics or
experiences.

380FD8385D3241B1BB0011641C9900D6.description:
An ELL can speak and write
about gradeappropriate

complex literary
and
informational
texts and topics

7F78B2CBA205423BABB3062610CA120B.description:
participate in
conversations and
discussions, ask and answer
questions, and follow rules for
discussion
about a variety of topics.

379E810A04DC4A00A3D690C5374FF843.description:
participate in
conversations and
discussions, ask and answer simple
questions, and follow increasing
number of rules for
discussion
about a variety of topics.

CED12845687843AD825930DABEE56010.description:
participate in short
conversations, follow some rules for
discussion, and respond to simple yes/no
and wh- questions
about familiar topics.

E19367FBC9C1424D9CDE06E88C95C36B.description:
participate in short
conversations and respond to simple yes/no
and wh- questions
about familiar topics.

28DBB837C99B447891714C59DA47EA47.description:
listen with limited
participation in short
conversations  and respond to simple
yes/no and some whquestions
about familiar topics.

1C0F5788DAFE4E95AF2FA60CCAA898FC.description:
An ELL can participate in
grade-appropriate
oral and written
exchanges of
information,
ideas, and
analyses,
responding to
peer, audience, or
reader comments
and questions.

A27D146228BB48B9868ACB0549805B32.description:
with prompting and
support (including context
and visual aids), use a
wide range of strategies
to: identify main topics, answer questions about
key details, and retell familiar stories
from read-alouds, picture
books, and oral
presentations

E8FDF7635ADC41AAA490CED411DB4DF3.description:
with prompting and
support (including context
and visual aids), use an
increasing range of
strategies to: identify main topics, answer questions
about key details or
parts of stories, and retell events
from read-alouds, picture
books, and oral
presentations

25A154A951F645E89FF23BDAA9494027.description:
with prompting and support
(including context and visual
aids), use a developing set of
strategies to: identify main topics and ask and answer questions
about key details
from read-alouds and oral
presentations.

4B1E478E64A049AE9A1AA2D024AFAD21.description:
with prompting and support
(including context and visual
aids), use an emerging set of
strategies to: identify some key words
and phrases
from read-alouds and oral
presentations

70A75AFA2DF94A67A8E10CAEB7B4852D.description:
with prompting and
support (including
context and visual aids),
use a very limited set of
strategies to:  identify a few key
words
from read-alouds and
oral presentations of
information or stories

97B48F81BA6D41F0A907325AB73DA2AF.description:
An ELL can construct
meaning from
oral presentations
and literary and
informational text
through grade appropriate

listening, reading,
and viewing.
